source_note: State baseline derived from Pennsylvania DEP Recycling Program and Act 101 guidelines; local programs may differ.

organics.guidance: Composting and yard waste recycling required for many municipalities under Act 101; food waste composting expanding statewide.
organics.bin: Green organics bin or compost drop-off.
organics.notes: Philadelphia and Pittsburgh offer compost pilot programs.
provenance: PA DEP Recycling and Waste Reduction Program

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean paper, cardboard, and cartons; flatten boxes.
paper_cardboard.notes: No waxed, greasy, or wet cardboard.

glass_containers.guidance: Recycle bottles and jars (rinsed, no lids).
glass_containers.bin: Mixed recycling or separate glass bin depending on locality.

metal_containers.guidance: Recycle aluminum and steel/tin cans (clean and empty).

plastics.guidance: Recycle bottles, jugs, and tubs labeled #1â€“#2; local programs vary for others.
plastics.notes: Plastic film and foam not accepted curbside.

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: No statewide bottle deposit law in Pennsylvania.
beverage_containers_crv.bin: Recycle via local curbside or drop-off program.

household_batteries.guidance: Recycle batteries through HHW programs or Call2Recycle drop-offs.
household_batteries.notes: Do not place batteries in trash or recycling carts.
provenance: PA DEP Household Hazardous Waste program

e_waste.guidance: Electronics recycling required under the Covered Device Recycling Act (CDRA).
e_waste.bin: Drop-off at certified e-waste collection sites.
e_waste.notes: Includes TVs, monitors, computers, and printers.

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Plastic bags and film not accepted curbside.
plastic_bags_and_film.notes: Plastic film causes contamination in recycling facilities.

bulky_items.guidance: Bulky items must be scheduled for pickup or dropped at landfill/transfer station.
bulky_items.notes: Local hauler or city sets collection rules and fees.
